results.title: French cancan
results.creator_credit: Franco London Film (Paris), Louis Wipf and Jean Renoir
results.brief_description: Beautifully photographed, this comedy-drama chronicles the revival of Paris’ most notorious dance as it tells the story of a theater producer who turns a humble washerwoman into a star at the Moulin Rouge. Renoir’s return to film-making in France after 15 years absence is an exuberant, affectionate homage to the theatre of ‘La Belle Epoque’ (Edith Piaf and Tatachou appear briefly as stars of the day.) It also gave him the opportunity to work with Gabin again, having made three films with him in the 1930s. Cast includes Jean Gabin, Francoise Arnoul and Maria Felix. In French with English subtitles.

results.description: Beautifully photographed, this comedy-drama chronicles the revival of Paris’ most notorious dance as it tells the story of a theater producer who turns a humble washerwoman into a star at the Moulin Rouge. Renoir’s return to film-making in France after 15 years absence is an exuberant, affectionate homage to the theatre of ‘La Belle Epoque’ (Edith Piaf and Tatachou appear briefly as stars of the day.) It also gave him the opportunity to work with Gabin again, having made three films with him in the 1930s. Cast includes Jean Gabin, Francoise Arnoul and Maria Felix. In French with English subtitles.
description_for_label: Beautifully photographed, this comedy-drama chronicles the revival of Paris’ most notorious dance as it tells the story of a theater producer who turns a humble washerwoman into a star at the Moulin Rouge. Renoir’s return to film-making in France after 15 years absence is an exuberant, affectionate homage to the theatre of ‘La Belle Epoque’ (Edith Piaf and Tatachou appear briefly as stars of the day.) It also gave him the opportunity to work with Gabin again, having made three films with him in the 1930s. Cast includes Jean Gabin, Francoise Arnoul and Maria Felix. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: French Canadians: the St Lawrence Lowland, Quebec
results.creator_credit: Louis de Rochemont Associates and J.H. Lenauer
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth and it’s peoples”.
Looks at life in the village of St Pierre in Quebec, depicting farming and dairying activities which have undergone little change for over three generations.

results.title: French & Saunders: the video
results.brief_description: Dawn French and Jennifer Saunders have formed one of the most successful comedy duos of the 1990’s. This collection of sketches from their successful BBC comedy series contains some of their best material as they disguise themselves in a variety of personas. Their comedy style varies from satire to slapstick and sketches such as “Fat men” and “Bus-stop gynaecology” are guaranteed to generate laughter.

results.title: French-Canadian children
results.brief_description: A study of the home, school, and community life of a French-Canadian family, showing in particular the influence of the French heritage as it affects speech, manners, and customs.

results.title: Fremantle, first port in Australia
results.creator_credit: Fremantle Port Authority and Les Bambury
results.brief_description: Port facilities at Fremantle, Western Australia. The modern administrative buildings; the port inspection ship “Challenger”; two berth passenger terminal; cargo handling; rail and air terminals. Also some highlights of the port’s history.
results.description: Port facilities at Fremantle, Western Australia. The modern administrative buildings; the port inspection ship “Challenger”; two berth passenger terminal; cargo handling; rail and air terminals. Also some highlights of the port’s history.

results.title: Fremantle cray fishers
results.brief_description: The departure of the cray fishing boats from Fremantle, Western Australia, in the early morning to the fishing grounds in the deep water. These hard working fishermen work a twelve hour day and are dependent on the weather and the mood of the sea for a good season. After the long day they return to port with their catch.

results.title: Freeze-in
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Albert Kish and F Whitman Trecartin
results.brief_description: A film essay without commentary about the port of Montreal as winter closes in - the last-minute scurry as ships that can make it dash for open water, while those that cannot prepare for a long hold-over. On the docks all activity seems suspended as the numbing cold closes its grip. But there is activity on the iced-in ships and in the freight sheds, making ready for the time when the icebreakers open a river channel and traffic returns. Film without words.

results.title: Freeway driving
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Emphasises the particular skills needed for safe use of freeways where road speed is greater than normal and driving dkills are different.

results.title: Freestyle nightclub
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dance Magic”.
Enjoy learning steps in the Nightclub Disco format. The figures may be danced to contemporary or Top 40 music in a variety of settings such as nightclubs, discos and parties.
